meanings.definition: The act of causing trouble or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: His constant botheration with the broken door handle led to its replacement.
meanings.sent2: The botheration of the noisy neighbors kept him up at night.
meanings.sent3: The botheration of the squirrels raiding the bird feeder was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The botheration of the leaky faucet was like a persistent drumbeat in the house.
meanings.sent5: The botheration of the mosquito buzzing around his head was unbearable.

meanings.definition: A state of being troubled or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the botheration of losing her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: The botheration in his expression was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The botheration of forgetting his lunch made him feel quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The botheration in her heart felt like a heavy weight dragging her down.
meanings.sent5: The botheration of the unanswered question lingered in his mind.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of frustration or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Botheration! I forgot my keys again.
meanings.sent2: Oh botheration, I spilled coffee on my shirt.
meanings.sent3: Botheration, the rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: The sudden botheration of a flat tire delayed their journey.
meanings.sent5: Botheration, I missed the last bus home.
